abstract.p: Recent speech at New York InfoTech Forum by Research In Motion Ltd chmn James Balsillie, creator of BlackBerry hand-held, wireless Internet device, prompts confessions from users who have become obsessively dependent on BlackBerry; Balsillie doubts device causes obsessive behavior, but concedes 'it definitely gives obsessive people an outlet' (M)

block.p: It was almost like a support group for people who had become obsessively dependent on their hand-held BlackBerry wireless Internet devices. New York businessmen were standing up, declaring ''I'm a BlackBerry-a-holic.'' One even acknowledged that he couldn't stop checking his e-mail throughout the recent event that prompted such confessions -- a speech by James Balsillie, the BlackBerry creator and chairman of Research In Motion Ltd.

''I check my e-mail a couple of hundred times a day,'' Mr. Balsillie said at the New York InfoTech Forum. ''I don't think BlackBerry causes obsessive behavior, but it definitely does give obsessive people an outlet.'' His wife, however, has objected. ''I'm definitely banned from using my BlackBerry at the dinner table,'' he said, though he still uses it in the bathtub.
